alert.note: Alert for Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 10:32PM EDT until July 29 at 2:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Whitesburg affecting Letcher County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Whitesburg. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Businesses begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EDT Thursday was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 2.0 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 07/01/1942. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 4 AM EDT.
